Your GP or pharmacist can check 
the information from the National 
Formulary for Children at  
https://bnfc.nice.org.uk to see 
what medicines can be given to 
babies and children, as these are 
likely to be safe for mothers to 
take when breastfeeding.
Why is aspirin sometimes given during 
pregnancy?
Some pregnant women are at risk of developing pre-
eclampsia (a serious condition which usually presents 
as high blood pressure and protein in
